column4: help... can't sudo from any account -- still have a root account terminal open to fix it ...  sudo: pam_authenticate: Authentication service cannot retrieve authentication info. - -- please help me!!
try to install sudo package
: could that mess the whole system up?
should be fine if you just reinstall the package
already the newest version
can you reinstall the package?
also checking google for ya. =)
how do i force reinstall of sudo ?
in synaptic, you can right click the sudo package and force a reinstall like that
running ubuntu-server 6.10 dapper drake
apt-get install sudo --reinstall
same error!
happened after a corruption in /etc/passwd
can you reinstall the passwd package? =)
and you will be given the ubuntu e-finger
the only things that i have found thus far are to reinstall /etc/passwd
improperly configured home account for the system
are there any user accounts working on the server, or are they not working, due to the corrupted passwd file?
sorry, in and out of the house. did you get it fixed or any more ideas?
nope
fixed it!
when i had copied a section of /etc/passwd from another system to myne trying to reconstruct a viable file -- i copied an account with the same uid!
